div1.p:
United States Consulate
St Paul de Loanda
Dec 14th 1882.

To Hon John Davis
Asst. Secty. of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to enclose herewith a translated copy of the letter from J. L. Torres Esqr one of Thomas Foster's master of Bark Alice Knowles given to Henry Williams, sent on shore at Mossamedes for sickness. I also enclose his affidavit, and those of David Miller, Charles Sims, & Augustus Jasan; runaway Am: seamen; Charles Sims and Augustus are also sick at present, and the Capt of the Portuguese steamer does not care to take them on board in their present condition. They are now upon this consulate for over a month, and not expecting any Am: vessel for the present, I shall be obliged to send them by some Portuguese merchant, vessel to Lisbon, if the Capt will take them, these men have not any clothes or shoes, but those given to them by this consulate

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be Sir
Respectfully
Your obedient servant
closer.signed:
L. de R. du Verge
US Consul

div1.p:
Translation
To L. de R. du Verge Esqre
United States Consul Loanda.

Without any favor from you to answer, I satisfy my last of the 8th of october per S.S. "Benguella." "Samples of produce from the district": Enclosed please find a bill of lading for a box of samples of the produce of Mossamedes, which will be sent on by the first packet, due in a few days, the said samples consist of:

Orchilla
Beans
Indn Corn
Rum
Wheat
Almeidina

With regard to these samples, I must say that Almeidina, is a produce from which 50 P.C. of good Indian Rubber is exhacted, what regards to wheat, this country has not produced anything to speak of, as they have not turned their attention to its cultivation, but lately and it has been sown to considerable extent, and they sanguinely expect a great result.
Produce exported from this Dispatch: as follows

Hides
Wax
Ivory
Dried Fish
Brine Do
Orchilla
Almeidina
Cotton
Vegetables
Fruits
Oxen
Cows
Sheep
Rum
Garden produce, Beans peas, &a &a Wheat sown as stated above

"American Shipping" The Am: Ship "Shelton" Capt. S.B. Potter, entered this port on the 7th of october sailed on the 19th of the same month; Whaling? On the 12th of the same month entd America Bark "Alice Knowles" Capt Thomas Foster, came in to request and returned Whaling on the 19th of the same. On the 10th of the same month entered Am. Ship "Eliza Adams" Capt Walter F. Howland; also came in to refresh and returned Whaling on the 27th ditto. From the Bark "Alice Knowles" the Sailor Henry Williams was landed sick, and who will go on to your City by the first packet, leaving a Certificate from this agency dated october 26th 1882. The "Eliza Adams" shipped on the 25th ult. 4 sailors, 2 of which ran away immediately after signing their articles and receiving 8 dollars and 50 cents in advance; they were arrested 2 days after the sailing of the ship, and I intend sending them on to your consulate by first favorable opportunity that you may dispose of them as you may think fit; It is probable that I shall have to advance the money for their passage of which I will duly advise you. Their names are "David Miller" and "Charles Sims". Another sailor, by name of "Augusto Fernandes" ran away from the said ship, and came to day to present himself to me; I shall send him also to you with
with the other 2. and advise the amount of passages and expences which I have advanced them here It seems to me proper to send them to Loanda that it may be known hereafter to all others coming here in future, that such acts will not be countenanced without being punished according to Law.

Being all for the present, I remain with all due respect and consideration
"Signed" João L. Torres
U.S. Consul Agent
P.S. The sailor above described as "Augustus Fernandes, is Augustus Jason".
